alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest North Carolina, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated continuing rain where soils are already saturated. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Murphy, Hiawasse Dam, Unaka, Culberson and Hot House. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
